Also, this is the first time I've seen the "who cares?" criticism leveled at Martin. That's an interesting perspective, because I always thought his criticisms were spot on.

instruction: What are the steps to using random (yet coherent) text as filler content within your Word document?
output:
Definition of filler content
Filler content is any material added to a publication or website to increase its size or reading time. Filler content may be informative, but it is usually not essential to the overall topic being discussed. For example, in an article about the best ways to lose weight, a list of the worst diets ever invented might be considered filler content because it does not directly relate to the main topic.

instruction:
I bought two shirts from the store and each one cost me $10. I also bought a pair of pants and they cost me $20. Then, I bought a dress and it cost me $30. Also,  I bought a pair of shoes and they cost me $40. Lastly, I bought a jacket and it cost me $50.

Make a table chart showing items, the number, and the price of these items. Separate columns with "|".
output:
| Item | Number | Price |
|------|--------|-------|
| Shirt 1 | 1      | $10   |
| Pants | 2      | $20   |
| Dress | 3      | $30   |
| Shoes | 4      | $40   |
| Jacket | 5      | $50   |
So, the total cost of all the items is:

$10 + $20 + $30 + $40 + $50 = $100

instruction:
Write a simple guide for uploading the bibliography database
 on Overleaf.
output:
## Uploading the bibliography database to Overleaf

Overleaf is a web-based platform for writing and collaborating on documents. It allows users to create documents in a variety of formats, including LaTeX. One of the benefits of using Overleaf is that it includes a built-in bibliography database which can be easily searched and added to your document. 

To upload the bibliography database to Overleaf, follow these steps:

1. Go to https://www.overleaf.com/start
2. Select "Sign Up" to create an account or log in if you already have an account.
3. Click on "New Project" and select "Blank Project".
4. In the "Project Settings" menu, click on "Bibliography" and select "Import Bibliographies".
5. Choose the format of your bibliography (e.g. APA, Chicago, MLA) and click "Select Bibliography".
6. Browse to the folder where your bibliography file is stored and select it.
7. Your bibliography will be added to your project and you can start adding it to your document.
8. To add a new entry to your bibliography, click on the plus sign (+) icon and fill out the appropriate fields.
9. When you are finished, click on "Save Changes" to save your changes.
10. You can now search and add entries to your bibliography as needed.

instruction: You should take the time to read the situation and problem carefully and give the best advice you can.
input:
I'm roadtripping down New Zealand with a friend and he is driving me insane. He hasn't enjoyed all the tours we've been on and doesn't want to chat about ANYTHING. We're a week into our trip and this is the quietest I've ever been when hanging out with another person as he rebuffs all my attempts at conversation. He wears his airpods in the car and around the accommodation - not that I've kept trying to talk to him. Honestly, he is bringing some seriously bad vibes to everything and it's ruining my trip.
We don't have anything booked in yet for the South Island, so I'm planning to ditch him in Wellington at the ferry. Probably book my own car in Picton and just relax alone for the rest of the trip. (Just thinking about it is such sharp relief that it makes me feel emotional. I'll pay whatever price I have to just to get away from him.)
Obviously telling him he is ruining my trip with his negative energy isn't the best way to approach this.
Any advice for the best approach so we can split amicably? Or at least not have an argument that ends with very hurt feelings?
output: I've only ever ditched people before, but I've always been the one getting ditched. This is a new experience for me!

instruction: A job description is a document that clearly states the requirements, duties, responsibilities, and skills required to perform a specific role. You need to write a job description based on the given information. You should describe responsibilities and duties in your job description in a logical order. Remember that potential employees often get their first impression of your company from your job description. So, the job description should convey the attractiveness of your company.
input:
Company: [Company name]
Job: Software Engineer
Job Responsibilities:
Receive and perform code reviews with other engineers.
Write unit, integration, and end-to-end tests to verify functionality using automated testing frameworks such as Pytest.
Work collaboratively with fellow software engineers to build features requested by business stakeholders.
Participate in Agile teams to develop, test, and debug complex data processing pipelines and data analysis applications using big data processing systems such as Apache Spark.
Diagnose, debug, and perform root cause analysis of issues and defects.
Skills and experience that will lead to success:
Experience with a modern software programming language. We use Python, and Pyspark extensively.
Experience with cloud systems like AWS or Azure
Experience writing SQL queries 
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Eagerness to work in a highly-collaborative environment
Some visualization experience such as Tableau or PowerBI is helpful
output: but not required.

instruction: Provide a Java solution to the following problem.
input:
Given an integer n, return true if it is a power of three. Otherwise, return false.
An integer n is a power of three, if there exists an integer x such that n == 3^x.

Example 1:
In: n = 27
Out: true
Explanation: 27 = 3^3

Example 2:
In: n = 0
Out: false
Explanation: There is no x where 3^x = 0.

Example 3:
In: n = -1
Out: false
Explanation: There is no x where 3x = (-1).
 
Constraints:
-231 <= n <= 231 - 1
Follow up: Could you solve it without loops/recursion?

instruction: You will need to guide this person through the scenario they have described for the interview.
input:
Finally! After a while of shooting in the dark and frantically fiddling with sample inputs on the whiteboard, you've came up with an algorithm for solving the coding question your interviewer gave you.
Whew. Such a relief to have a clear path forward. To not be flailing anymore.
Now you're cruising, getting ready to code up your solution.
When suddenly, your interviewer throws you a curve ball.
"What if we thought of the problem this way?"
You feel a tension we've all felt during the coding interview:
"Try to listen to what they're saying...but don't lose your train of thought...ugh, I can't do both!"
output:
As you've dug into the problem, you might have started to see patterns in how you can approach it. You might be so deep in those patterns that your initial train of thought is now no longer relevant.
Your mind knows what you came up with before, but your interviewer is describing a new scenario. It's like you're at the bottom of a well, and they're describing a different mountain a few miles away. It's frustrating, because you just spent all this time focusing on one problem - and yet here they are, asking you to think about a completely different one.
It's ok! This happens often. Your interviewer wants to make sure you can adapt to different scenarios. It also helps them understand your mindset. They want to know: "Can this person adapt? Can they come up with multiple solutions to the same problem? Are they flexible?"
If you find yourself in this situation, try to take a moment to listen to what your interviewer is saying. Don't worry about losing your previous train of thought. Just focus on what they're describing now. Write down some notes as they talk. Then, after they stop talking, take a few moments to reset. Refresh your thoughts, and go back to your original problem. Then, come up with a solution for this new scenario.
You'll likely find that the first solution you had is still applicable, but tweaked slightly. If not, then there's another path to explore!
One thing to keep in mind: don't fall into analysis paralysis. If you spend too long trying to think about a new problem, your interviewer will sense that you're stuck. They want to see that you can think quickly on your feet, and pivot to a new problem, while keeping an open mind.
This is normal! Interviewers want to test how you

instruction: Summarize the article you have been given in a brief manner.
input:
Mathematics and art are related in a variety of ways. Mathematics has itself been described as an art motivated by beauty. Mathematics can be discerned in arts such as music, dance, painting, architecture, sculpture, and textiles. This article focuses, however, on mathematics in the visual arts.
Mathematics and art have a long historical relationship. Artists have used mathematics since the 4th century BC when the Greek sculptor Polykleitos wrote his Canon, prescribing proportions conjectured to have been based on the ratio 1:√2 for the ideal male nude. Persistent popular claims have been made for the use of the golden ratio in ancient art and architecture, without reliable evidence. In the Italian Renaissance, Luca Pacioli wrote the influential treatise De divina proportione (1509), illustrated with woodcuts by Leonardo da Vinci, on the use of the golden ratio in art. Another Italian painter, Piero della Francesca, developed Euclid's ideas on perspective in treatises such as De Prospectiva Pingendi, and in his paintings. The engraver Albrecht Dürer made many references to mathematics in his work Melencolia I. In modern times, the graphic artist M. C. Escher made intensive use of tessellation and hyperbolic geometry, with the help of the mathematician H. S. M. Coxeter, while the De Stijl movement led by Theo van Doesburg and Piet Mondrian explicitly embraced geometrical forms. Mathematics has inspired textile arts such as quilting, knitting, cross-stitch, crochet, embroidery, weaving, Turkish and other carpet-making, as well as kilim. In Islamic art, symmetries are evident in forms as varied as Persian girih and Moroccan zellige tilework, Mughal jali pierced stone screens, and widespread muqarnas vaulting.
output:
Moreover, in the 20th century, the Russian constructivists promoted architecture and design based on mathematical principles.
The appreciation of mathematics in art can take many forms. In geometry, for example, one can see the use of projective geometry in Mondrian's work: in his later career he limited himself to using only three colors, black, white, and red. Other examples are the Islamic gardens that have been drawn according to the mathematical theory of the Spirograph; the harmony and balance found in Japanese gardens is partly a result of the use of symmetry and proportion; and the study of tessellations has inspired artists such as Escher to create works like Relief with Spheres.

instruction: Improve the article using your knowledge of the topic in order to make it more informative.
input: The "fair trade" movement, also known as the "trade justice" movement, promotes the use of labour, environmental and social standards for the production of commodities, particularly those exported from the Third and Second Worlds to the First World. Such ideas have also sparked a debate on whether trade itself should be codified as a human right.
output: The fair trade movement is a social movement that promotes the use of labour, environmental and social standards for the production of commodities, particularly those exported from the Third and Second Worlds to the First World. It seeks to benefit producers in developing countries by ensuring they receive a price which covers the costs of sustainable production and also guarantees them a dignified lifestyle. The fair trade movement has gained significant traction in recent years, with the sale of fair trade certified products increasing from US$1 billion in 2004 to US$10.7 billion in 2014.

instruction: An evaluation of the article's quality should be carried out. In order to do so, you should review the quality of the writing and the explanation of the topic.
input:
The 20th century saw a revolution in music listening as the radio gained popularity worldwide and new media and technologies were developed to record, edit and distribute music. Music performances became increasingly visual with the broadcast and recording of performances.
20th-century music brought new freedom and wide experimentation with new musical styles and forms that challenged the accepted rules of music of earlier periods. The invention of musical amplification and electronic instruments, especially the synthesizer, in the mid-20th century revolutionized classical and popular music, and accelerated the development of new forms of music.
output: In the second half of the century, electronic instruments and music production technology developed at a rapid pace, leading to new forms of music and an increased diversity of musical genres.

instruction: Please answer the following question based on the information provided in the article.
input:
Development studies is an interdisciplinary branch of social science. Development studies is offered as a specialized master's degree in a number of reputed universities around the world. It has grown in popularity as a subject of study since the early 1990s, and has been most widely taught and researched in developing countries and countries with a colonial history, such as the UK, where the discipline originated.  Students of development studies often choose careers in international organisations such as the United Nations, World Bank, non-governmental organisations (NGOs), media and journalism houses, private sector development consultancy firms, corporate social responsibility (CSR) bodies and research centers.
What are some popular careers for students of development studies?

instruction: Please list the courses that someone interested in the first course might like.
input: Bitcoin and Cryptocurrency Technologies
output:
(MIT)
This course introduces the student to the revolutionary Bitcoin protocol and the larger ecosystem of cryptocurrencies that it has spawned. It describes the architecture and key components of the Bitcoin protocol, blockchains, wallets and mining, as well as how transactions work and how new bitcoins are created. The course also covers more advanced topics such as smart contracts, decentralized applications, and oracles. No prior knowledge of programming or cryptography is necessary.
Web3 and Smart Contracts with Ethereum (Udacity)
This course provides an introduction to web3 and smart contracts, focusing on the Ethereum platform. It covers the basics of web3 development, including writing smart contracts in Solidity, deploying contracts to the Ethereum blockchain, and interacting with them from front-end applications. It also introduces concepts such as state machines, event-driven logic, and decentralized oracles. No prior knowledge of programming or blockchain technology is required.
Blockchain Technology and Applications (Alison)
This course provides an introduction to blockchain technology and its applications. It covers the basics of blockchain architecture, consensus algorithms, and distributed ledger technology. It also examines the use of blockchain in various industries, such as finance, supply chain management, and digital identity. The course is designed for beginners with no prior knowledge of blockchain technology.
Introduction to Blockchain Technology (Coursera)
This course provides an introduction to the basics of blockchain technology and its applications. It covers the fundamentals of blockchain architecture, consensus algorithms, and cryptographic hashing. It also examines the use of blockchain in various industries, such as finance, supply chain management, and digital identity. The course is designed for beginners with

instruction: Provide a detailed explanation of the steps that are required in order to construct the given project.
input: Steam Engine Using an Empty Beer Can
output:
This steam engine uses an empty beer can as the boiler.
The beer can is sealed with duct tape and holes are cut on both sides for the steam to escape.
A copper tube is soldered to one end of the beer can and a rubber hose is attached to the other end.
A potato is used as the piston, which is pushed up and down by a string connected to a penny at the other end of the copper tube.
As the steam pushes the piston up, it turns the wheel and generates power.

instruction: Describe how to prepare the given food in your own words. Note down the ingredients you will need and the steps you will take to prepare them.
input: Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookies
output:
are a delicious and easy-to-make treat. You will need:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
2. In a large bowl, cream together the butter, brown sugar, and white sugar until smooth.
3. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla.
4. In another bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
5. Gradually blend the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients.
6. Stir in the chocolate chips.
7. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet.
8. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven, until the cookies are lightly browned.
9. Remove from the oven and let cool on the cookie sheet for 10 minutes.
10. Transfer the cookies to wire racks to cool completely.

instruction: Suggest a recipe for a vegan dessert.
output:
Rainbow Sherbet Delight
1. Combine the crushed cookies, coconut and butter in a large bowl.
2. Press half of the mixture firmly into the base of an 8-inch square pan.
3. In a medium bowl, whisk together the sweetened condensed milk and almond extract.
4. Spread the filling over the cookie layer.
5. Sprinkle the remaining cookie mixture over the filling.
6. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours or until set.
7. To serve, cut into squares and enjoy!

output:

instruction: Describe the content of the article in a brief manner.
input: A study published earlier this year by Zee and her team examined the role of light in sleep for healthy adults in their 20s. Sleeping for only one night with a dim light, such as a TV set with the sound off, raised the blood sugar and heart rate of the young people during the sleep lab experiment. An elevated heart rate at night has been shown in prior studies to be a risk factor for future heart disease and early death, while higher blood sugar levels are a sign of insulin resistance, which can ultimately lead to type 2 diabetes.
output:
The researchers found that the sleepers' blood sugar levels rose by an average of 6% after a night of dim light exposure. The heart rate of study participants increased by an average of 5 beats per minute, or about 40%, compared to when they were exposed to a completely dark room. After one night with the dim light, heart rates remained elevated over the following two nights of complete darkness.
Light is known to suppress the release of melatonin, a hormone that helps regulate sleep. But Zee said previous studies have shown that lower levels of melatonin do not fully explain the increase in blood sugar and heart rate associated with sleeping in the dark.
"We know that light at night can suppress melatonin and that melatonin can lower your blood pressure," she said. "But our results show that something else is going on. In fact, we think that the extra activity in the brain may be what's increasing blood sugar levels."
The study also looked at whether exercise might help counteract any negative effects of sleeping in the dim light. The researchers discovered that while exercise did decrease the amount of glucose the young people's bodies produced, it didn't entirely reverse the negative impact of sleeping with the dim light.
"Exercise is great for improving insulin sensitivity and lowering blood sugar, but if you are exercising late at night, then you are probably more likely to be exposed to light, because you are outdoors or in a well-lit gym," she said. "So we don't think exercise is enough to completely prevent these negative health effects from dim light exposure."
Zee added that the study shows how vital it is to keep bedrooms dark at night, including using blackout shades or wearing an eye covering to block out light. She also noted that smartphones

instruction: Extract the method that has been used in the research from the abstract of the paper. Give the exact sentences from the abstract that discuss the method.
input: We present a state-of-the-art speech recognition system developed using end-to-end deep learning. Our architecture is significantly simpler than traditional speech systems, which rely on laboriously engineered processing pipelines; these traditional systems also tend to perform poorly when used in noisy environments. In contrast, our system does not need hand-designed components to model background noise, reverberation, or speaker variation, but instead directly learns a function that is robust to such effects. We do not need a phoneme dictionary, nor even the concept of a "phoneme." Key to our approach is a well-optimized RNN training system that uses multiple GPUs, as well as a set of novel data synthesis techniques that allow us to efficiently obtain a large amount of varied data for training. Our system, called Deep Speech, outperforms previously published results on the widely studied Switchboard Hub5'00, achieving 16.0% error on the full test set. Deep Speech also handles challenging noisy environments better than widely used, state-of-the-art commercial speech systems.Collapse

instruction: List a few popular songs from the given album.
input: Back To Black
output:
is the second studio album by English singer Duffy. It was released on 7 November 2008 in the United Kingdom and internationally on 13 January 2009. The album reached number one on the UK Albums Chart, and has been certified platinum in the UK. Internationally, it peaked in the top ten of record charts in over ten countries, including Australia, Ireland and the United States.
The lead single "Mercy" was released in July 2008 and spent nine weeks at number one on the UK Singles Chart, becoming the ninth best-selling single of 2008 in that country. "Warwick Avenue" followed as the second single from the album, and became Duffy's third consecutive top five hit in the UK. Subsequently, "Stepping Stone" and "Oh Boy" were released as singles, both reaching the top twenty in the UK. The album was nominated for the 2009 Mercury Prize.

instruction: Regex is a set of characters that define a search pattern. This kind of pattern is usually used by string-searching algorithms to find or replace strings or to validate inputs. Convert the natural english text to regex.
input: Match a valid ip address
output:
with regex. In this case, the regular expression will match any string that contains both an ipv4 address and a colon.
The following regular expressions find strings that contain numbers. Note that there is some overlap between these examples and those for matching strings that contain only lowercase letters. That's because it can be difficult to tell where one ends and the other begins in some cases. For example, phone numbers usually start with digits but can include non-digit punctuation, such as periods and spaces:
Regular expression to match an IPv4 address. This regular expression matches a valid IPv4 address in dot-decimal notation. The Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) recommends using the IPv4 address format of xxx.yyy.zzz.wwww instead of the more commonly used format of xxxx.yyyy.zzzz.www. The last two octets are optional and may be omitted when assigning an IP address.

My name is Jane and I'm a student. I use Gmail to communicate with my friends, family, and professors. I like that I can access my email from anywhere and that it's very easy to use. I also like the spam filters, which keep my inbox clean of unwanted messages. Overall, Gmail is a great tool for staying connected with others.

instruction: Include important study notes and key points that someone should know about the given subject.
input: history of the USA
output:
.
The history of the United States is what happened in the past in the United States, including its geographic expansion, governments, and cultures. Native American cultures had many different kinds, but were generally farming villages or tribes (band) composed of hunter-gatherers. By the 17th century, the Iroquois Confederacy was established in what is now upstate New York. Its member tribes had developed a form of democracy that influenced the Founding Fathers' Constitutional Convention. The Thirteen Colonies became a new nation through the Treaty of Paris in 1783 after fighting the American Revolutionary War against Britain. The new nation adopted a written constitution in 1787, which created a federal government with an elected legislature and an executive branch led by a president.

instruction: For a quick and efficient office workout, suggest a short routine.
output:
Tips for a quick and efficient office workout:
1. Start with a warm-up, which can include marching in place, arm circles, or jumping jacks.
2. Then, perform a few rounds of high-intensity exercises, such as burpees, squats, or jump rope.
3. Follow it up with a cool-down, which can include gentle stretching or walking.
4. End with a final set of low-intensity exercises, such as yoga poses or neck stretches.

instruction: Predict how many stars the author will give to the restaurant from a Yelp review.
input:
The reviews were great, but honestly i felt it was just ok. Seemed like a typical tourist spot were the food was mediocre. The service was ok, not great, but not the worst.
The bread was very good. I ordered the muscle fries. They had a sweet Vidalia onion flavor. No need for fries bc they were soggy wo much flavor. My boyfriend ordered a pesto chicken pasta and it was again mediocre.
output: Okay, so I'm going to start by saying that my husband and I were pretty disappointed with this place. We actually went here twice because the first time we thought it was just an off night. We went back a second time since it was right by our hotel and had heard great things about it. Both times we went, the ambiance was great, but the food left a lot to be desired. 1st visit: The service was slow and the food arrived at different intervals. The fish was overcooked and the sauce tasted like it came out of a can. My husband ordered the pork chop and that was also terrible (dry and tough). The calamari was okay but lacked flavor. I would not recommend this place to anyone. 2nd visit: Same thing happened. Slow service, food came at different times. This time we ended up having to send our pasta back bc it was cold and congealed. When we asked for something else they didn't have anything else to offer. Not impressed at all.

instruction: Design a simple training challenge on Strava that everyone could attend.
output:
Sorry for the delayed response! It’s not too late to join, but you would have to create a challenge on Strava. Here are the steps:
1. Go to your dashboard and click “Challenges”.
2. Click the blue button that says “Create Challenge” in the top right corner.
3. Choose a name for your challenge, select the date and time you want it to start, and set the duration.
4. You can choose who the challenge is visible to by clicking on the “Who can join?” dropdown list. You can make it public or just invite specific athletes.
5. Decide if you want to allow guests to join the challenge or not.
6. You can customize the route by clicking on the map or entering the precise route in the text field below the map.
7. Click “Create Challenge” when you’re done.
8. Share the challenge with your friends on social media or via email, so that they can join.
You can also join existing challenges that other users have created. Just search for the challenge on Strava and click “Join Challenge”.
